results.title: Deadlock
results.brief_description: The film starts when Anna (played by Kerry Fox) has called the police to arrest her defacto Serge (played by Raj Sidhu). The film explores their relationship and how the violent tendencies of Serge develop and worsen over time. The line has been crossed. What was frustration and anger has been revealed to be a pattern of violent behaviour. Anna observes this and decides to take action, albeit not soon enough.

results.title: Revolution of necessity
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
The discovery of how to turn coke into fuel launches the Industrial Revolution. The need for better pumps in the mines eventually leads to the steam engine, which together with the railway transforms society. Bessemer’s converter gives the world cheap steel.

results.title: Death and the maiden
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Josh Kramer, Thom Mount and Behind the Scenes
results.brief_description: What if you had the chance to seek revenge for the crimes committed against you? Paulina Escobar (Sigourney Weaver), is faced with this moral dilemma when she confronts who she believes was her tormentor; a sadistic doctor who subjected her to physical, sexual and mental abuse 15 years ago when she was held hostage by South American Government interrogators. Paulina leads a quiet and nervous lifestyle with her husband (Stuart Wilson). This shaky semblance of peace is disrupted when her husband is brought home by a good Samaritan (Ben Kingsley) when his car breaks down during a storm. Alarm bells ring when Paulina recognises the voice from her blindfolded ordeal. Her husband is not convinced he is the offender and as a lawyer is challenged by her to present a case against the conviction.

results.title: Into the machine age
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
The ever expanding American iron and steel industry spawns the railroads that help to reunify a country riven by civil war. In the aftermath of the Chicago fire on 1871, the industry creates the steel-framed skycraper. The discovery of vast reserves of oil, and the advent of mass production, mark the last quarter of the nineteenth century.

results.title: Deadline
results.creator_credit: Nash Edgerton and Blue Tongue Films
results.brief_description: Drummoyne 4.50 pm - a young man races across various Sydney suburbs, headed for Kings Cross, at a furiously reckless pace. Accompanied by a rocking punk-skater soundtrack this Australian short film amuses greatly with its almost dialogue-less encounters and frenetic pace. Cast includes Nash Edgerton and John Polson.

results.title: From alchemy to the atom
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode six from “Out of the Fiery Furnace.” Scientists of the 20th century discover how to to transform matter not into gold but into energy. European scientists work towards an understanding of atoms and the energy they release.

results.title: From stone to bronze
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode 1 in the fascinating series called “Out of the fiery furnace.” Opening in the Stone Age this episode explores how mankind came to recognize metals, showing their accidental production in an Indian pottery kiln, and an experiment in smelting copper in the Sinai using Egyptian techniques of about 1500 BC.

results.title: Death and destiny: a Journey into Ancient Egypt
results.brief_description: At Saqqara, just south of the Great Pyramids, lies what is arguably the most important archaeological site in Egypt. At this site, the careful excavation work and detective cunning of an Australian archaeologist has uncovered clues to the assassination of a Pharaoh; a plot that involved court officials, the Pharaoh’s bodyguard and harem. Narrated by Phillip Adams.

results.title: Dead set
results.brief_description: The Australian music scene is presented here by producer/writer/director Rob Payne in an entertaining and fascinating way. Includes live performances from popular Australian bands; Spiderbait, You Am I, Powderfinger, Ammonia, Jebediah, Frenzal Rhomb, Bodyjar, Regurgitator, Crow, Custard, Grinspoon, Something for Kate and Augie March. Interspersed with the performances are insights by band members and recognised industry heavyweights Richard Kingsmill and Damien Lovelock. Material covered includes; Attitude; covering the influence of the American grunge scene, Australia’s geographical isolation and what sounds Australian; Cross Over; the inability to define Australian music by a specific genre and the cross over between mainstream, alternative and punk; Influences; discusses how different influences contribute to Australian music’s diverse sound; Live; the quite healthy existence of the live scene; Festivals; the importance of festivals such as the Big Day Out, Homebake, The Falls and what it means to performers and spectators; JJJ; the influence of ‘The Australian Music Show’ and Unearthed; Lyrics; how song lyrics come about, or in some cases, don’t; Overdrive; a candid discussion of behind the scenes activities, such as accommodation and parties. A fascinating documentary that will appeal to fans of the band as well as anyone with an interest in Australian music.

results.title: Shining conquests
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
EPISODE 3 OF OUT OF THE FIERY FURNACE. The flood of wealth from precious metals helps finance the Renaissance, and a great wave of colonization and exploration. In a later century came the “democratic” gold rushes in America and Australia, followed by capital intensive deep-lead mining. The social implications are discussed.
